chapter.title: Hardware Setup
chapter.para: This chapter contains steps to configure hardware drivers for different types of SS7 cards.

important.para: Ensure that you have root/administrator privileges before proceeding.

section.title: Sangoma
section.para: Following section describe how to install Sangoma card on RHEL operating system.

note.para: All software is kept at /usr/src as per default, however this is not mandatory and you can install driver at any location you wish. Substitute the path correctly in steps below if dahdi drivers are not downloaded at /usr/src

step.para: Answer y to: Would you like to install WANPIPE now? [y] (y/n)

step.screen: Would you like to configure wanpipe devices for DAHDI? (y/n)

Would you like to generate /etc/asterisk/chan_dahdi.conf
1. YES 2. NO

Select media type for AFT-A108 on port 1 [slot:4 bus:4 span:1]
1. T1 2. E1 3. Unused 4. Exit
step.para: It should show the configuration for port 1

step.screen:
Configuring port 1 on 108 as E1, line coding:HDB3, framing:CRC4
1. YES - Keep these settings 2. NO - Configure line coding and framing [1-2, ENTER='YES']: 1

step.para: Answer 1(NORMAL) to question about clock synchronization:
step.screen:
Select clock for AFT-A108 on port 1 [slot:4 bus:4 span:1]
1. NORMAL 2. MASTER [1-2]:1

Select signalling type for AFT-A108 on port 1 [slot:4 bus:4 span:1]
1. Zaptel/Dahdi - PRI CPE 2. Zaptel/Dahdi - PRI NET 3. Zaptel/Dahdi - E & M 4. Zaptel/Dahdi - E & M Wink 5. Zaptel/Dahdi - FXS - Loop Start 6. Zaptel/Dahdi - FXS - Ground Start 7. Zaptel/Dahdi - FXS - Kewl Start 8. Zaptel/Dahdi - FX0 - Loop Start 9. Zaptel/Dahdi - FX0 - Ground Start 10. Zaptel/Dahdi - FX0 - Kewl Start 11. Sangoma SMG/sangoma_prid- PRI CPE 12. Sangoma SMG/sangoma_prid- PRI NET [1-12]:1

Would you like to enable hardware DTMF detection?
1. YES 2. NO [1-2, ENTER='YES']:2

step.para: Above step is last, now setup will repeat itself for each port present on your sangoma card. For instance A102 has only one port, hence above setup will be repeated only once. For A108, it will repeat itself seven times.

However you need not configure all the ports and depends on how many links are available for you. Lets assume that we have only one link. Hence for rest of the ports select Unused option as shown bellow:
step.screen:
Select media type for AFT-A108 on port 2 [slot:4 bus:4 span:2]
1. T1 2. E1 3. Unused 4. Exit [1-4, ENTER='E1']: 3

step.para: Once all ports are configured, answer 1(YES) to:
step.screen:
Configuration Complete! Please select following:
1. YES - Continue 2. NO - Exit [1-2]: 1

Dahdi and Wanpipe configuration complete: choose action
1. Save cfg: Restart Asterisk & Wanpipe now 2. Save cfg: Restart Asterisk & Wanpipe when convenient 3. Save cfg: Stop Asterisk & Wanpipe now 4. Save cfg: Stop Asterisk & Wanpipe when convenient 5. Save cfg: Save cfg only (Not Recommanded!!!) 6. Do not save cfg: Exit [1-6]:1

step.para: Wait for WanRouter to start and answer 1(YES) to:
step.screen:
Would you like wanrouter to start on system boot?
1. YES 2. NO [1-2]:1

Would you like to execute 'dahdi_cfg' each time wanrouter starts?
1. YES 2. NO [1-2]:1

step.para: This concludes installation of WANPipe . You may check status by typing:
change the TDMV_DCHAN from 16 to 0. For Mobicents Media Server all chhanles are same and mobicents media server will differentiate between the voice and signalling channel via its configuration.
change TDMV_HWEC from YES to NO as we don't want any Hardware Echo Cancellation
Change the bchan=1-31 and remove/comment-out echocanceller and hardhdlc

step.screen:
$ tail -f /var/log/messages
Oct 5 15:10:16 dhcp211-127 kernel: wanpipe1: Enable E1 CCS Signalling mode! Oct 5 15:10:16 dhcp211-127 kernel: wanpipe2: Enable E1 CCS Signalling mode!
